text:
Katerina Ivanovna spoke proudly. 

"My husband danced for the governor," she said. 

"That proves my noble lineage!" 

She waved the certificate. 

Drunken guests laughed, clutching the paper. 

"Your father was a major," one sneered.

Katerina clenched her fists. 

"We’ll open a boarding school in T——!" she declared. 

"We’ll hire a respectable Frenchman, Mangot, to teach." 

Sonia will help, she thought. 

A loud guffaw echoed from the table. 

Katerina raised her voice. 

"Ignore them! We are better than those stuck-up draggletails!" 

Her heart raced as she spoke.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Katerina Ivanovna boasts about her noble background and plans to open a boarding school, hoping to impress her guests.
